• The indication for the CD is still valid.
• Broad-spectrum intravenous antibiotics have been given.
o These may be either prophylactic or therapeutic antibiotics.
o Routinely, a dual regimen of IV prophylactic antibiotics (cefazolin 1g and Azithromycin 500 mg) is
given one hour pre-op, irrespective of whether the operation is an emergency or elective procedure,
and there is no need to give further doses of antibiotics post-op.
